headline: Cheesy Chicken, Broccoli, and Rice Casserole
description: Cubed chicken, rice, tender broccoli florets, and gooey cheddar cheese are baked in a rich sauce for this family-favorite casserole.
recipeIngredient: 10 to 12 ounces fresh broccoli crowns, or 10 ounces frozen broccoli florets
8 ounces sharp cheddar cheese (about 2 cups shredded), divided

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Arrange one rack in the middle of the oven and a second rack in the upper third of the oven. Heat the oven to 400°F.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Dice 1 pound cooked chicken into bite-sized pieces (about 3 cups). Dice 1 medium yellow onion (about 1 1/2 cups) and mince 2 garlic cloves.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: If using fresh broccoli, cut 10 to 12 ounces broccoli crowns into small, bite-sized florets (about 4 cups). If using frozen broccoli, let sit at room temperature to thaw while the casserole bakes. Shred 8 ounces sharp cheddar cheese on the large holes of a box grater (about 2 cups) if needed.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Melt 3 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large, high-sided oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and 1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt. Sauté until tender and golden-brown, 4 to 6 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Add 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour and cook, stirring often, for 1 minute, to cook the floury taste out. Slowly pour in 1 (14.5-ounce) can low-sodium chicken broth and whisk to combine, breaking up any lumps of flour and onion and scraping browned bits from the bottom of the pan.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Pour in 1/2 cup whole or 2% milk, add 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and whisk until combined. Bring to a boil. Continue to boil, whisking constantly, until the sauce thickens slightly, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken, and half of the cheese, and 3/4 cup uncooked long-grain white rice. Stir to combine. Spread into an even layer or transfer to a 2 1/2- to 3-quart baking dish. Cover with a lid or aluminum foil.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
recipeInstructions.text: Bake on the middle rack until the rice is tender, about 45 minutes. Carefully uncover, add the broccoli, and stir to combine. Spread back into an even layer and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Return to the middle rack of the oven and bake uncovered until the broccoli is tender and the cheese on top is melted, 10 to 15 minutes more. If your baking dish or skillet is broiler-safe, move the casserole to the upper rack and broil until the top is browned, 1 to 2 minutes.

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: Bake the casserole as instructed until the rice is tender, about 45 minutes. Stir in the broccoli and top with the cheese, then cool, cover, and freeze for up to 1 month. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator. Reheat, covered, in the oven at 350ºF until heated through, 30 to 45 minutes.Storage: Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 4 days.

name: Cheesy Chicken, Broccoli, and Rice Casserole

author.name: Patty Catalano
author.description: Patty is a recipe developer and food writer. She worked Alton Brown’s Research Coordinator and podcast producer and in the Oxmoor House test kitchen. She loves maple syrup, coffee and board games. Patty lives in Atlanta with her husband and two children.
